intro: Cynoglossum columnae var. nebrodense, commonly known as the Nebroden Alps bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
